FuncDef:
The l2 binding vlan command binds a VLAN to a BD.
The undo l2 binding vlan command cancels the binding relationship between a VLAN and a BD. The l2 binding vlan command binds a VLAN to a BD. The undo l2 binding vlan command cancels the binding relationship between a VLAN and a BD. By default, a VLAN is not bound to a BD. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo: On the VXLAN network, you need to configure VXLAN service access points on a VXLAN network edge node. After you run the l2 binding vlan command to bind a VLAN to a BD. The interfaces added to the VLAN become VXLAN service access points.
